study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether dietary supplementation with omega-3 fatty acids, including flaxseed oil, could improve lipid composition of meibum, tear evaporation, and tear volume in patients with dry eye.
results_summary: The study found that omega-3 supplementation, including flaxseed oil, increased tear production and volume but had no significant effect on meibum lipid composition or tear evaporation rate. A higher percentage of patients in the omega-3 group became asymptomatic compared to the placebo group.
population_specificity: Patients with dry eye (n=36).
effective_dosage: 1000 mg flaxseed oil daily (as part of a combined omega-3 supplement).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether incorporating flaxseed into lifestyle counseling provides additional benefits in managing metabolic syndrome (MetS) compared to lifestyle counseling alone.
results_summary: Flaxseed supplementation (30 g/d) combined with lifestyle counseling significantly reduced the prevalence of MetS and improved central obesity reversion rates compared to lifestyle counseling alone, though overall MetS reversion rates were not significantly different between groups. Most metabolic variables improved across all groups, with flaxseed showing specific benefits for central obesity.
population_specificity: 283 participants screened for MetS using updated National Cholesterol Education Program Adult Treatment Panel III criteria for Asian Americans.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if an 8-week diet supplemented with flaxseed oil (ALA) would alter Lp-PLA(2) levels, an inflammatory marker linked to cardiovascular disease, in healthy adults aged 50+.
results_summary: The study found no significant changes in Lp-PLA(2) mass or activity after flaxseed oil supplementation, though changes in oxidized LDL were associated with Lp-PLA(2) mass.
population_specificity: Healthy adults aged 50+ (~75% female, average age 61 years).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine the mechanisms by which n-3 PUFAs, including alpha linolenic acid from flaxseed oil, exert cardioprotective effects against cardiovascular disease.
results_summary: The study found that n-3 PUFAs, including those from flaxseed oil, provide cardiovascular benefits through multiple mechanisms such as anti-inflammation, modulation of lipid mediators, reduction of triglycerides, and antiarrhythmic effects. These effects are supported by epidemiological and intervention studies, as well as cellular and molecular research.
population_specificity: Not specified (general cardiovascular health focus)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to test whether daily intake of flaxseed-enriched bread could reduce climacteric symptoms and affect endometrial thickness in postmenopausal women.
results_summary: The study found that flaxseed consumption (46 mg lignans/day) was safe but no more effective than placebo in reducing hot flashes and Kupperman Menopausal Index scores, with no impact on endometrial thickness.
population_specificity: Postmenopausal women (1-10 years postmenopause)
effective_dosage: 25 g of partially defatted ground flaxseed (46 mg lignans) daily via 2 slices of bread

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effects of milled flaxseed or flaxseed oil on glycemic control, n-3 fatty acid status, anthropometrics, and adipokines in individuals with type 2 diabetes.
results_summary: The study found that flaxseed intake increased plasma phospholipid n-3 fatty acids but did not affect glycemic control. The flaxseed groups maintained body weight, while the control group gained weight.
population_specificity: Adults with well-controlled type 2 diabetes (age 52.4 ± 1.5 years, BMI 32.4 ± 1.0 kg/m², 17 men and 17 women).
effective_dosage: 32 g/day milled flaxseed (FXS) or 13 g/day flaxseed oil (FXO).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine which component of flaxseed (SDG lignan or flaxseed oil) enhances tamoxifen's effectiveness in reducing estrogen receptor-positive breast tumor growth and the mechanisms involved.
results_summary: Both SDG and flaxseed oil reduced tumor growth by decreasing cell proliferation and modulating ER- and growth factor-mediated signaling pathways, with flaxseed oil showing greater efficacy in increasing apoptosis compared to tamoxifen alone.
population_specificity: Ovariectomized athymic mice with established MCF-7 estrogen receptor-positive breast tumors.
effective_dosage: SDG (1 g/kg diet), flaxseed oil (38.5 g/kg diet), or combined SDG and FO (levels equivalent to a 10% flaxseed diet).
interactions: Interaction with tamoxifen was studied, but no other interactions mentioned.

study_goal: The researchers were attempting to determine whether alterations in gut microbiota abundance correlate with exercise performance in long-distance runners.
results_summary: The study found a correlation between gut microbiota abundance and exercise performance, but the abstract does not specify the effects of flaxseed.
population_specificity: 25 male long-distance runners

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effects of flaxseed supplementation on lipid profile and liver enzymes through a meta-analysis of randomized controlled trials.
results_summary: Flaxseed supplementation significantly reduced triglycerides and liver enzymes (AST and ALT) while increasing HDL levels, with more pronounced effects on ALT at doses below 2000 mg/day.
population_specificity: Not specified (meta-analysis of randomized controlled trials)
effective_dosage: Doses below 2000 mg/day showed more pronounced effects on ALT.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the impacts of flaxseed supplementation on inflammatory biomarkers in adults through a meta-analysis of randomized controlled trials.
results_summary: Flaxseed supplementation significantly reduced C-reactive protein (CRP) levels, indicating a potential anti-inflammatory effect, though the abstract notes conflicting findings in some studies. The analysis included 54 RCTs involving 3000 individuals, showing a statistically significant reduction in CRP (SMD = -0.46; 95% CI: -0.70, -0.23, P < 0.001).
population_specificity: Adults from 12 countries (3000 individuals).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of flaxseed supplementation on functional constipation and quality of life in adults with chronic functional constipation.
results_summary: Flaxseed supplementation significantly improved bowel habits, reduced Wexner constipation scores, increased defecation frequency, and enhanced quality of life, with slightly better efficacy than lactulose.
population_specificity: Adult men and women in China diagnosed with functional constipation by Rome IV criteria.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to systematically review and meta-analyze randomized controlled trials to determine the effects of flaxseed supplementation on blood lipid profiles.
results_summary: Flaxseed supplementation significantly reduced total cholesterol, triglycerides, and LDL-C but had no effect on HDL-C, suggesting potential benefits for delaying heart disease progression.
population_specificity: 3772 participants across 62 randomized controlled trials.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effect of flaxseed supplementation on serum adiponectin and leptin concentrations through a systematic review and meta-analysis of randomized controlled trials.
results_summary: Flaxseed supplementation did not significantly affect adiponectin or leptin levels in adults, with nonsignificant effects across subgroups based on trial duration, flaxseed type, and participant health status. The results remained robust in sensitivity analysis.
population_specificity: Adults (specific health status not detailed beyond general inclusion of RCTs)
study_duration: Varied (subgroup analysis considered trial duration but specific lengths not detailed)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of co-supplementation with vitamin D and n-3 fatty acids from flaxseed oil on cardiometabolic risk markers in diabetic patients with coronary heart disease (CHD).
results_summary: Co-supplementation significantly reduced carotid intima-media thickness (CIMT), fasting plasma glucose, insulin, insulin resistance, LDL-cholesterol, and high-sensitivity C-reactive protein, while increasing insulin sensitivity and HDL-cholesterol compared to placebo.
population_specificity: Vitamin D-deficient diabetic patients with CHD (n=61).
effective_dosage: 2× 1000 mg/d n-3 fatty acids from flaxseed oil.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to systematically review and analyze RCTs assessing the effects of flaxseed consumption on body weight and body composition.
results_summary: The study found conflicting results from RCTs regarding flaxseed's association with obesity, with mean changes in body composition indices (weight, BMI, waist circumference) analyzed using weighted mean differences and confidence intervals.
population_specificity: Not specified in the abstract (general population inferred).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the metabolic and endocrine effects of essential omega-3 PUFAs from flaxseed oil versus long-chain omega-3 PUFAs from fish oil in women with polycystic ovary syndrome (PCOS).
results_summary: Flaxseed oil significantly lowered serum triglycerides and showed no adverse effects on glucose or insulin parameters, unlike fish oil, which had mixed metabolic effects. The study concluded that flaxseed and fish oil should not be used interchangeably due to their distinct effects.
population_specificity: Women with polycystic ovary syndrome (PCOS).
effective_dosage: 3.5 g of n-3 PUFA per day.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of grounded flaxseed and flaxseed oil on inflammatory markers, metabolic parameters, and disease severity in patients with ulcerative colitis (UC).
results_summary: Both grounded flaxseed and flaxseed oil significantly reduced inflammatory markers (IL-6, INF-γ, ESR, fecal calprotectin), disease severity (Mayo score), blood pressure, and waist circumference, while increasing TGF-β and IBDQ-9 scores. No significant differences were observed between flaxseed and flaxseed oil groups except for TGF-β.
population_specificity: 75 UC patients (43 men, 32 women) with a mean age of 31.54 ± 9.84 years.
effective_dosage: Grounded flaxseed (30 g/day), flaxseed oil (10 g/day).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of omega-3 fatty acids from flaxseed oil on gene expression related to insulin and lipid signaling in women with PCOS.
results_summary: Omega-3 fatty acids from flaxseed oil upregulated PPAR-γ mRNA and downregulated LDLR mRNA in women with PCOS, but had no significant effect on GLUT-1 or Lp(a) gene expression.
population_specificity: Women aged 18-40 years diagnosed with PCOS according to the Rotterdam criteria.
effective_dosage: 1,000 mg omega-3 fatty acids (containing 400 mg α-linolenic acid) twice daily.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy of flaxseed supplementation on adhesion molecules and inflammatory cytokines in adults.
results_summary: Flaxseed supplementation significantly reduced CRP, IL-6, and VCAM-1 levels but had no significant effect on TNF-α, ICAM-1, and E-selectin. The findings suggest potential benefits for specific inflammatory markers but require further confirmation.
population_specificity: Adults (2520 participants across 40 RCTs)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of omega-3 fatty acid supplementation from flaxseed oil on inflammatory cytokines and advanced glycation end products (AGEs) in patients with diabetic nephropathy.
results_summary: Omega-3 fatty acid supplementation significantly reduced serum AGEs but had no significant effect on inflammatory cytokines compared to placebo. The receptor for AGEs showed a reduction in the omega-3 group, but no significant difference between groups was observed.
population_specificity: 60 patients with diabetic nephropathy.
effective_dosage: 1000 mg/d of omega-3 fatty acid from flaxseed oil.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effects of flaxseed supplementation on erythrocyte polyunsaturated fatty acids (PUFAs) and serum biomarkers related to inflammation, endothelial dysfunction, oxidative stress, and thrombosis in individuals with risk factors for metabolic syndrome (MetS).
results_summary: Flaxseed supplementation significantly increased erythrocyte n-3 PUFAs and decreased n-6 PUFAs and the n-6/n-3 ratio but showed no additional benefits beyond lifestyle counseling for most serum biomarkers tested. Some inflammatory markers declined in both groups, but no between-group differences were observed.
population_specificity: Chinese individuals with two or more components of metabolic syndrome (MetS).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effect of dietary flaxseed oil on colorectal cancer growth in vivo and compare its efficacy to walnuts.
results_summary: Flaxseed oil significantly reduced tumor growth rate by 43% and final tumor weight by 44% compared to the control. It also decreased serum angiogenesis factors and increased necrotic areas in tumors.
population_specificity: 6-week-old female nude mice injected with HT-29 human colon cancer cells.
effective_dosage: ~19% of total energy from flaxseed oil.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate whether chitosan (CS) could protect against fluoride-induced kidney toxicity in rats.
results_summary: Fluoride caused nephrotoxicity, increasing kidney volume, inflammatory markers (caspase-3, TNF-α), and serum urea/creatinine levels, while CS treatment reversed these effects and restored kidney structure.
population_specificity: 28 rats divided into four groups (n=7 per group).
effective_dosage: 100 mg/L NaF in drinking water; 250 mg/kg/day CS by gastric gavage.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the antioxidant activity of flaxseed and its role in reducing inflammation and insulin resistance in obese glucose-intolerant individuals.
results_summary: Flaxseed supplementation reduced oxidative stress (TBARS) and insulin resistance (HOMA-IR) but did not affect inflammatory biomarkers. A positive correlation was found between oxidative stress and insulin resistance.
population_specificity: Obese glucose-intolerant individuals (n=9).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of a novel calcium hydroxide-supported cation exchange resin composite (NCHO/CER) for fluoride removal in water.
results_summary: The study confirmed the formation of calcium hydroxide nanoparticles in the CER structure, demonstrated effective fluoride adsorption following pseudo-second-order kinetics and Freundlich isotherm models, and showed reusability and applicability in real-world water sources like tap water and groundwater.
population_specificity: Not specified (water samples, not human subjects)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of Silver Diamine Fluoride (SDF) as a primary treatment for Ellis Class IX anterior tooth trauma in young children with behavioral challenges.
results_summary: SDF was successfully used in four cases, yielding satisfactory outcomes and a favorable prognosis for the affected teeth, while also improving the children's attitudes toward dental care. The treatment was well-tolerated and required minimal equipment.
population_specificity: Very young children with negative behavior responses in the dental setting.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effect of sodium fluoride (NaF) on testicular dysfunction in rats and explore the role of the androgen receptor signaling pathway in maintaining fertility during NaF treatment.
results_summary: NaF exposure increased testis weight and malondialdehyde (MDA) levels while decreasing serum LH, FSH, and testosterone concentrations. Testicular histological damage was observed, but Artemisia absinthium extract ameliorated these effects.
population_specificity: Male rats (32 divided into four groups).
effective_dosage: NaF at 12 mg/kg body weight orally.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop a cost-effective adsorbent (SA@RM) from sodium alginate and red mud for fluoride removal in water, while valorizing industrial waste.
results_summary: The adsorbent achieved 92% fluoride removal, demonstrated exceptional cyclic stability (54.8% capacity retention over three regeneration cycles), and followed Langmuir isotherm and pseudo-second-order kinetics, indicating monolayer chemisorption as the dominant mechanism. Advanced characterization revealed fluoride complexation with aluminum oxides, ligand exchange, and ion exchange as key mechanisms.
population_specificity: Industrial wastewater treatment (not human consumption).
effective_dosage: 15 g/L adsorbent dosage, pH 5, initial fluoride concentration of 11.7 mg/L.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine how incorporating ZnO-Nanoclay into PVDF membranes affects their antifouling, mechanical, and antibacterial properties.
results_summary: Adding ZnO-Nanoclay significantly improved antifouling properties (99.92% inhibition at 3 wt%), increased water-flux rates by 16% (1 wt%), and enhanced mechanical strength by 500% (3 wt%). The study demonstrated enhanced membrane performance and durability.
population_specificity: Not applicable (in vitro study on PVDF membranes).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the anti-biofilm properties of fluoride non-thermal atmospheric plasma (FNTAP) against dual-species biofilms of Streptococcus mutans and Streptococcus sanguinis.
results_summary: FNTAP significantly reduced bacterial load by over 5 log units and prevented biofilm regrowth, while also reducing medium acidification compared to controls. ArNTAP showed immediate bacterial reduction but no significant impact on regrowth.
population_specificity: In vitro dual-species biofilms (Streptococcus mutans and Streptococcus sanguinis).
effective_dosage: 5 or 10 standard cubic centimeters per minute (sccm) of FNTAP.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether a PVDF/Bi2S3 composite could enhance photocatalytic sterilization efficacy for wound dressings.
results_summary: The PVDF/Bi2S3 composite demonstrated superior antibacterial performance against E. coli and MRSA compared to PVDF or Bi2S3 alone, with enhanced photocatalytic efficiency under vibration conditions, promoting wound healing in mice.
population_specificity: Mice with trauma wounds.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the integration of silver diamine fluoride (SDF) into an existing school-based dental program to improve efficiency and reduce logistical challenges.
results_summary: The study found that integrating SDF led to a 23% increase in patients served, a 53% reduction in per-child treatment time, and significant cost reductions in labor (45%) and supplies (24%). Clinicians reported strong support for simplified protocols and increased flexibility.
population_specificity: School-aged children in a program serving 16 schools.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the utility of 18F-NaF PET in evaluating vertebral bone metabolism in diabetic patients and test the effects of vitamin K1 and colchicine on 18F-NaF activity.
results_summary: The study found that 18F-NaF PET may be useful for measuring vertebral bone metabolism in diabetic patients. Colchicine reduced 18F-NaF vertebral uptake, while vitamin K1 had no effect.
population_specificity: Diabetic patients aged 50-80 (66.4% male, mean age 65.5 ± 6.8 years).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of different frequencies of 38% silver diamine fluoride (SDF) application in halting the progression of active dentin coronal carious lesions in primary teeth of children aged 2-6 years.
results_summary: The study found that more frequent SDF applications (four times per year) were significantly more effective in halting caries progression (80.5% arrest rate) compared to biannual (78.2%) or annual (58.4%) applications, particularly in high-risk tribal children with limited dental care access.
population_specificity: Children aged 2-6 years with cavitated carious lesions, primarily from a tribal population in Wayanad, India.
effective_dosage: 38% SDF applied at frequencies of once per year, twice per year, or four times per year (baseline, 2, 4, and 8 weeks).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of school-based fluoride varnish delivery programs (SFVDP) in preventing dental caries among children.
results_summary: SFVDP reduced caries initiation by 32% in permanent teeth and 25% in primary teeth, with effectiveness varying by socioeconomic status. The programs also increased the number of annual fluoride varnish applications.
population_specificity: Children in preschool through high school, primarily from low socioeconomic status areas and at elevated caries risk.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether stannous fluoride (SnF2) desensitizing toothpaste affects the immediate dentin sealing ability of universal adhesive in human intact dentin.
results_summary: The study found that SnF2 pretreatment did not significantly reduce the immediate dentin sealing ability of universal adhesive, with no adverse effects observed. SEM-EDS analysis confirmed the presence of silicon and tin in SnF2-treated dentin but no significant impact on bonding efficacy.
population_specificity: Extracted intact third molars from human subjects.
effective_dosage: Not specified (SnF2 desensitizing toothpaste used as pretreatment).
study_duration: Immediate effects assessed (no long-term follow-up mentioned).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the safety and efficacy of community water fluoridation (CWF) and systemic fluoride administration, particularly for pregnant women and young children.
results_summary: The study found that topical fluoride is effective in preventing dental caries, but systemic fluoride ingestion offers little benefit to fetuses and young infants and may cause dental fluorosis and cognitive deficits. The risk-benefit ratio of CWF appears unfavorable for pregnant women and young children in environments with multiple fluoride sources.
population_specificity: Pregnant women and young children.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate how the surface properties of poled poly(vinylidene fluoride) (PVDF) films affect cell adhesion, proliferation, and protein adsorption.
results_summary: The study found that poling treatment under a strong electric field stabilized the surface aggregation states of PVDF films, resisting structural reorganization upon water exposure. This stable surface promoted cell adhesion, proliferation, and protein adsorption.
population_specificity: Not specified (in vitro study on polymer films)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate whether adding 2% sodium fluoride (NaF) to an in-office bleaching gel reduces bleaching sensitivity (BS) and affects tooth whitening effectiveness.
results_summary: The study found that 2% NaF significantly reduced cold sensitivity after 90 days but did not significantly impact tactile or spontaneous sensitivity or whitening effectiveness compared to the control.
population_specificity: 29 patients (from an initial 32) undergoing in-office tooth bleaching.
effective_dosage: 2% NaF added to the bleaching gel, applied once for 45 minutes.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effect of silver diamine fluoride (SDF) on the microtensile bond strength and resin-dentin interface of universal adhesive in etch-and-rinse mode under thermocycling.
results_summary: SDF enhanced bonding durability, with higher microtensile bond strength observed in treated groups compared to controls, though resin tag uniformity was reduced. Silver deposition was detected beneath the adhesive layer, indicating SDF's interaction with dentin.
population_specificity: Human dentin discs with artificial caries lesions.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine changes in silver diamine fluoride (SDF) utilization among Medicaid-enrolled children before and during the COVID-19 pandemic and assess the impact of demographics and state-level policies on its use.
results_summary: SDF utilization increased significantly from 2019 to 2021, particularly among children aged 0-6 years, rural residents, and American Indian/Alaskan Native children. State-level reimbursement policies were the strongest predictor of SDF use, with children in states with such policies being 10.5 times more likely to receive treatment.
population_specificity: Medicaid and Children's Health Insurance Program (CHIP) beneficiaries aged under 21 years in the United States.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the dual adsorption capacity of a novel adsorbent for fluoride (FL) and methylene blue (MB) in water treatment.
results_summary: The adsorbent demonstrated a maximum adsorption capacity of 14.8 mg/g for fluoride at pH 6.0, attributed to its enhanced surface area and ion-exchange behavior, suggesting effective pollutant removal.
population_specificity: Not applicable (in vitro study using synthesized adsorbent).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of modified alginate-based adsorbents (AZ and ALZ) in removing fluoride from water.
results_summary: Both AZ and ALZ achieved over 70% fluoride removal efficiency, with ALZ showing higher adsorption capacities (up to 410.81 mg g-1 at 50°C). The process was spontaneous and followed Langmuir isotherm and pseudo-second-order kinetics.
population_specificity: Industrial and drinking water samples.
effective_dosage: Not specified (adsorption capacities: 70.27–410.81 mg g-1 depending on material and temperature).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of silver-fluoride combined with potassium-iodide (AgF+KI) in reducing hypersensitivity in permanent molars affected by molar incisor hypomineralization (MIH).
results_summary: The study found that AgF+KI significantly reduced hypersensitivity immediately (15 minutes) and maintained this reduction after 3 months, with mean SCASS scores declining from 2.5 to 1.0. The effect was consistent across treated and untreated molars, though the percentage reduction from baseline was not statistically significant.
population_specificity: 22 children with 53 hypersensitive MIH-affected permanent molars (MIH TNI 3 or 4).
effective_dosage: Not specified (application method described as single treatment after isolation with cotton rolls).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects of sodium fluoride on myopia progression and explore its molecular mechanisms, particularly its role in activating the ferroptosis pathway.
results_summary: Sodium fluoride was found to promote myopia progression by activating the ferroptosis pathway via PIEZO1, and the PIEZO1 inhibitor GsMTx4 or baicalin could inhibit this effect, suggesting potential therapeutic targets for myopia treatment.
population_specificity: Not specified (likely animal or in vitro models based on methods mentioned).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effect of silver diamine fluoride (SDF) on microhardness and microleakage of composite and glass ionomer cement restorations.
results_summary: SDF conditioning negatively impacted microhardness and increased microleakage, reducing the longevity of restorations. Composite restorations without SDF showed the lowest microleakage and highest microhardness.
population_specificity: Extracted human teeth

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the taste acceptance of different fluoride varnish preparations among children with autism spectrum disorder (ASD) to improve compliance during dental visits.
results_summary: No significant differences in taste acceptance were found among the three fluoride varnishes, but Duraphat® showed a significant improvement in non-verbal positive behavior post-application. Subjective taste responses did not differ significantly among the varnishes.
population_specificity: Autistic children aged 6-14 years referred for preventive dental care.
study_duration: Single application (immediate and post-application responses measured)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of fluoride, alone and combined with CPP-ACP, on inhibiting enamel demineralization under pH cycling conditions.
results_summary: All treatment groups (including fluoride) showed significantly reduced enamel demineralization compared to the control, but no significant differences were found among the treatment groups. CPP-ACP was more effective at deeper enamel layers (50 and 120 μm).
population_specificity: Enamel blocks (in vitro study)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the relationship between fluoride exposure and glucose metabolism, focusing on its potential role in insulin resistance and diabetes-related complications.
results_summary: The study found a negative association between fluoride exposure and diabetes, indicating fluoride's potential to impair glucose homeostasis and increase insulin resistance. The research highlighted fluoride's impact on blood sugar and diabetes-related complications.
population_specificity: Normal organisms (14 studies), animals exposed to diabetes (5 studies), and a human population study (1 study).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the mechanisms by which fluoride exposure during pregnancy affects neurodevelopment and cognitive function in offspring.
results_summary: High fluoride exposure during pregnancy caused cognitive deficits in offspring, reduced TET1 and PSD95 expression, increased neuronal apoptosis, and altered Bcl2 hydroxymethylation. Tet1 knock-out mice showed similar cognitive deficits, suggesting TET1 downregulation as a key mechanism.
population_specificity: Pregnant mice and their male offspring.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the mechanism by which gut microbiota influences high fluoride exposure-induced hippocampal lesions and spatial memory dysfunction in mice.
results_summary: High fluoride exposure caused hippocampal tissue damage, spatial memory dysfunction, impaired intestinal permeability, and reduced inflammatory cytokines and antioxidant capability. Antibiotic intervention reversed these effects, with specific gut microbiota species identified as key mediators.
population_specificity: Mice
effective_dosage: 24 mg/kg sodium fluoride per mouse via gavage

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the mechanisms by which fluoride combined with aluminum (FA) induces hippocampal neuron damage in second-generation rat offspring (F2) and whether rapamycin (Rap) could mitigate this damage by enhancing autophagy.
results_summary: The study found that FA exposure caused hippocampal neuron damage in F2 rats and NG108-15 cells, but Rap treatment activated the AMPK/mTOR/ULK1 signaling pathway, enhancing autophagy and restoring near-normal neuronal morphology. Both mRNA and protein expression changes supported these findings.
population_specificity: Second-generation rat offspring (F2) and NG108-15 cells.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the mechanical properties, fluoride release, and dentine hardness changes between acid-resistant and conventional glass ionomer cements (GICs) under acidic conditions simulating caries and erosion.
results_summary: The study found no significant differences in flexural strength between acid-resistant and conventional GICs, but conventional GIC initially released more fluoride. Acid-resistant GIC showed better resistance to demineralization under erosive conditions, preserving dentine hardness more effectively.
population_specificity: Bovine teeth specimens (in vitro study).
effective_dosage: Not specified (fluoride release measured in ppm).
study_duration: 3 days for flexural strength and fluoride release; 8-10 days for dentine hardness under carious/erosive conditions.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the protective effects of various fluoride compounds (TiF₄, SnF₂, NaF) against dental erosion using a mouse model.
results_summary: Metal fluorides (TiF₄ and SnF₂) formed protective coatings and significantly reduced tooth tissue loss (37% and 67%, respectively), outperforming NaF (6% reduction). SnF₂ was most effective in preserving enamel and minimizing dentin exposure.
population_specificity: Young CD-1 mice.
effective_dosage: 0.5 mol/l (9500 ppm F) solutions applied twice a week.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop a polyvinylidene fluoride (PVDF)-based hybrid membrane with enhanced photocatalytic properties for treating textile printing/dyeing wastewater.
results_summary: The PVDF/SCA hybrid membrane demonstrated excellent piezo-photocatalytic performance for wastewater purification under ultrasonic and light energy, surpassing most reported photocatalysts. The study highlighted the membrane's superior recyclability and stable catalytic performance.
population_specificity: Industrial textile printing/dyeing wastewater

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate whether anthocyanins could protect against fluoride-induced neurological damage caused by endoplasmic reticulum stress.
results_summary: Fluoride exposure reduced learning and memory ability in rats, caused histopathological and ultrastructural damage, increased oxidative stress and endoplasmic reticulum stress, and elevated neuronal apoptosis. Anthocyanins treatment reversed these effects, restoring damage and reducing apoptosis.
population_specificity: Wistar rats

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the fluoride adsorption capacity and reusability of a CeO2/attapulgite composite for water treatment.
results_summary: The CeO2/ATP composite achieved a maximum fluoride adsorption capacity of 47.84 mg/g, followed pseudo-second-order kinetics, and maintained 30.2 mg/g capacity over five reuse cycles. The adsorption process fit the Langmuir isotherm model, indicating effective fluoride removal.
population_specificity: Not applicable (in vitro study on water treatment).
effective_dosage: Not applicable (adsorption capacity measured in mg/g).
study_duration: Not specified (reusability tested over five cycles).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the survival outcomes of teeth treated with silver diamine fluoride (SDF) in older adults over a 2-year period.
results_summary: The study found a 24-month survival rate of 45% for teeth treated with SDF, with multiple reapplications prolonging survival time. Poorer outcomes were observed in patients with higher baseline restorative treatment needs.
population_specificity: Older adults in a dental school setting.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop an electrochemical method for efficiently extracting high-purity uranium from nuclear wastewater containing high concentrations of fluoride ions.
results_summary: The study demonstrated that the designed tandem electrochemical device with ensemble Lewis sites achieved 99.9% uranium extraction efficiency and minimized impurities (2.2% alkali metals) in the final product, outperforming previous methods. The ensemble Lewis sites enhanced binding of uranyl fluoride species through strengthened chemical bonds.
population_specificity: Real nuclear wastewater (not human or animal subjects).
study_duration: 3 hours of electrolysis in 1 L of wastewater.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the remineralization efficiency of Ginger, Ashwagandha, and Maca dentifrices versus a commercially available fluoride-containing dentifrice.
results_summary: The study found that Maca showed the highest Ca/P ratio, Ginger exhibited significant surface microhardness recovery, and Ashwagandha had lower remineralization ability compared to other groups. Fluoride's effects were indirectly assessed by comparison with the herbal dentifrices.
population_specificity: Eighty collected teeth (in vitro study).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the accuracy of different DFT methods for computing fluoride ion affinities (FIAs) in small main-group Lewis acids and compare direct FIA computations with indirect anchor-point methods.
results_summary: The study found that modern DFT functionals with low self-interaction errors and diffuse basis sets perform comparably or better than traditional anchor-point methods for FIA computations, challenging the assumption that anchor-point approaches are superior. The widely used Me3Si+ anchor-point method often worsened results due to breakdowns in error cancellation.
population_specificity: Small main-group Lewis acids (71 compounds).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the mechanism by which tea polyphenols (TPs) mitigate fluoride-induced oxidative stress in intestinal porcine epithelial cells.
results_summary: Fluoride induced dose-dependent cytotoxicity, oxidative stress, and apoptosis in IPEC-J2 cells, while tea polyphenols alleviated these effects by reducing ROS generation, promoting antioxidant enzyme activity, and enhancing tight junction protein transcription.
population_specificity: Intestinal porcine epithelial (IPEC-J2) cells

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of three delivery methods (microbrush, dental floss, Super Floss®) for applying silver diamine fluoride (SDF) to initial interproximal caries in an in vitro model.
results_summary: Super Floss® and dental floss were significantly more effective than microbrush in delivering SDF to interproximal caries, as measured by stained lesion area and depth, but no difference was found in mineral density change between methods.
population_specificity: Extracted permanent premolars in an in vitro tooth-to-tooth interproximal contact model.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the performance of a novel polyvinylidene fluoride and zeolite nanocomposite membrane (PVDF+Ze@MP) for water purification, focusing on ion exchange properties, stability, and selective ion transport.
results_summary: The PVDF+Ze@MP membrane demonstrated excellent ion exchange properties, high cation selectivity, and robust thermal, mechanical, and chemical stability. It showed resilience in acidic and basic environments, with enhanced ion separation efficiency and low fouling behavior.
population_specificity: Not applicable (in vitro study on membrane performance).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the protective effects of silver fluoride solution (SDF-KI) and fluoride varnish against dental erosion in mice exposed to a cola drink.
results_summary: Fluoride varnish reduced tooth tissue loss by 5%, while silver fluoride solution showed a 35% reduction compared to the positive control. Silver fluoride solution provided significantly greater protection against dental erosion than traditional fluoride varnish.
population_specificity: Young CD-1 mice
effective_dosage: Silver fluoride solution (38% SDF, 48,000 ppm F, 253,900 ppm silver); fluoride varnish (NaF, 22,600 ppm F), applied twice weekly

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare caregiver satisfaction and children's acceptance of silver fluoride/potassium iodide (AgF + KI) versus glass-ionomer cement (GIC) in reducing hypersensitivity in permanent molars affected by molar incisor hypomineralisation (MIH).
results_summary: Both AgF + KI and GIC applications effectively reduced hypersensitivity in MIH-affected molars, with high caregiver satisfaction and positive child behavior. However, AgF + KI's taste was less acceptable compared to GIC, and caregivers showed a preference for alternative treatments.
population_specificity: Schoolchildren (mean age 8.6 ± 1.42) with hypersensitive MIH molars (Schiff cold air sensitivity score of 2 or 3).
study_duration: Immediate assessment (15 min post-application) and 12-week follow-up.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the combined impact of fluoride and xylitol varnish on reducing bacteria (Streptococcus mutans and Lactobacillus) in saliva and biofilms around orthodontic brackets.
results_summary: Fluoride and combined fluoride/xylitol varnishes significantly reduced S. mutans and Lactobacillus in saliva and biofilm, with no significant difference between them, and both were more effective than xylitol alone.
population_specificity: 120 patients requiring fixed orthodontic treatment.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether a fluoride-rich LPSCl shell could improve the atmospheric stability and electrochemical properties of sulfide-based solid electrolytes.
results_summary: The study found that the fluoride-rich LPSCl shell effectively suppressed side reactions with moisture, maintained low electronic conductivity, and improved electrochemical performance, including enhanced initial discharge capacity and cycling stability.
population_specificity: Not specified (laboratory study on materials)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effect of NaOCl (5.25%) prior to resin infiltration and resin varnish on microhardness, surface roughness, and DIAGNOdent Pen values in treating white spot lesions (WSLs).
results_summary: All treatment procedures improved demineralized enamel compared to the negative control group. NaOCl application before resin infiltration increased microhardness but also roughness, while resin-infiltrated groups showed less microleakage than resin-varnish-treated groups.
population_specificity: Human enamel samples (160) with artificial initial caries lesions.
effective_dosage: NaOCl (5.25%) applied prior to resin infiltration or varnish.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine rates of fluoride varnish (FV) application in a medical setting and identify factors associated with its receipt during well-child exams.
results_summary: The study found low but increasing rates of FV application (0.1% in 2018 to 1.6% in 2020), with higher rates among Black and Hispanic children and those with Medicaid insurance. ARNPs and PAs were underutilized for FV application.
population_specificity: Children attending well-child exams at a tertiary care center (2018-2021).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the role of fluoride ions (F-) in enhancing the degradation of organic pollutants like atrazine (ATZ) via peroxymonosulfate (PMS) activation by cobalt ferrite (CoFe2O4).
results_summary: The addition of F- significantly improved ATZ degradation from 82% to 98% within 10 minutes and increased the reaction rate. F- also enhanced the degradation of other organic substances and mitigated negative impacts from common water constituents.
population_specificity: Not applicable (laboratory study on chemical reactions, not human or animal subjects).
effective_dosage: Not specified (low concentration mentioned but not quantified).
study_duration: Up to two hours for ATZ degradation verification.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy of fluoride varnish and fluoride-releasing composites in preventing white spot lesions, plaque accumulation, and maintaining gingival health in orthodontic patients.
results_summary: The study found statistically significant improvements in plaque index and gingival index with fluoride varnish and fluoride-releasing composites, but no significant difference in demineralization. In vitro results showed significant differences in shear bond strength between fluoride varnish and other groups.
population_specificity: Orthodontic patients (in vivo) and extracted premolars (in vitro).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop and evaluate a fluoride-doped glass ceramic varnish for inhibiting oral microorganisms, releasing hydroxyapatite-forming ions, and ensuring biocompatibility.
results_summary: The varnish demonstrated biocompatibility, antimicrobial effects (except for C. albicans), and significant fluoride ion release, with V20CF10 releasing 4 times more fluoride ions than commercial varnishes in a shorter time. It also showed anti-biofilm effects on S. mutans.
population_specificity: In vitro study (VERO cells, S. mutans, S. aureus, C. albicans)
effective_dosage: 10% and 20% by weight of glass ceramics (CF0, CF5, CF10)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess parental acceptance of silver diamine fluoride (SDF) treatment for dental caries in children, focusing on aesthetic concerns and demographic influences.
results_summary: Parental acceptance of SDF treatment was higher for posterior teeth (51.2% agreed, 24.2% strongly agreed) but lower for anterior teeth (23.3% agreed, 10.7% strongly agreed), with education and income significantly influencing acceptance.
population_specificity: Parents of children aged 6-7 years in Najaf city, Iraq.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effect of silver diamine fluoride (SDF) on tooth discoloration when used with composite resin restoration at different application times.
results_summary: The study found no statistical difference in color changes between immediate and delayed composite application after SDF treatment, though delayed application showed less discoloration under laboratory conditions.
population_specificity: Extracted human premolar permanent teeth from periodontal or orthodontic therapy.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the molecular mechanisms of fluoride-induced mitochondrial dysfunction and sperm quality reduction via mitochondria-associated ER membranes (MAMs) in spermatogenic cells.
results_summary: Fluoride exposure impaired mitochondrial function, increased ER-mitochondria contacts, altered calcium regulation, and elevated apoptosis markers. Inhibiting IP3R1/MCU pathways mitigated these effects, suggesting potential therapeutic targets for fluorosis.
population_specificity: Mice and GC-2spd cells (a spermatocyte cell line)
effective_dosage: 25, 50, and 100 mg/L NaF (mice); 1.5, 2.0, and 2.5 mM NaF (GC-2spd cells)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether silver diamine fluoride (SDF) effectively arrests dental caries in primary teeth of young children compared to a placebo.
results_summary: The study found that 87% of carious lesions in the SDF-treated group showed arrest after one year, compared to only 35% in the control group, with a statistically significant difference (P < 0.001). No notable side effects were reported.
population_specificity: Children aged 3-6 with at least one carious lesion in their primary teeth.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to verify the feasibility of PVDF membranes with large pores for generating PCL microspheres via the combined crystallization diffusion (CCD) approach and assess their wound healing potential.
results_summary: The study found that PCL microspheres produced with 20 wt% concentration had optimal size (24.14 µm) and narrow distribution, achieving high drug loading efficiency (8.42% for baicalin). These microspheres showed gradual drug release over 33 days, significantly improved cell growth (111.67%), and enhanced wound healing compared to homogenization-produced microspheres.
population_specificity: Not specified (in vitro testing and cell growth assessment).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the remineralizing efficacy of grape seed extract (GSE) and sodium fluoride (NaF) on enamel lesions in an in vitro setting.
results_summary: The NaF group showed significant increases in surface (45%) and subsurface (35%) microhardness compared to the control, with GSE demonstrating similar efficacy (40% and 30%, respectively). Both treatments were significantly more effective than the control, with no statistically significant difference between NaF and GSE.
population_specificity: Extracted human premolars (in vitro study).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate whether combining diode laser irradiation with fluoride varnish improves white spot lesion prevention compared to fluoride varnish alone.
results_summary: The study found no significant difference in microhardness change between fluoride varnish alone and the combined treatment, suggesting laser irradiation did not enhance fluoride's preventive effect. The control group showed the greatest microhardness loss, indicating fluoride's benefit over no treatment.
population_specificity: Extracted human premolars (39 teeth)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine how chelating agents (EDTA and citric acid) influence fluoride removal efficiency during aluminum coagulation in industrial effluent treatment.
results_summary: EDTA reduced fluoride removal by up to 95.4% with AlCl3 and 28.3% with Al13, while citric acid inhibited removal by up to 100% with AlCl3 and 90.6% with Al13. The interference was due to the formation of EDTA-Al-F ternary complexes and Al-CA binary complexes, with Al13 showing greater stability against chelators.
population_specificity: Industrial effluents (not human subjects).
interactions: EDTA and citric acid impaired fluoride removal by disrupting floc formation.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the shear bond strength of glass ionomer cement to demineralized dentin in primary teeth treated with silver diamine fluoride (SDF) and potassium iodide (KI).
results_summary: The study found that treating dentin with SDF+KI before applying glass ionomer cement increased shear bond strength without negatively impacting the bond strength of the cement to dentin. The results suggest a beneficial interaction between SDF+KI and GIC in pediatric dental applications.
population_specificity: Non-carious primary molar teeth (pediatric dentistry context).
study_duration: Demineralization period was 7 days; immediate application of treatments was tested.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects of fluoride stress on the partial denitrification (PD) process in nitrogen-rich wastewater treatment.
results_summary: PD activity remained resilient to fluoride shock up to 1.5 g/L but was impaired at 2.0-3.0 g/L. Long-term fluoride stress at 0.5 g/L reduced nitrate-to-nitrite transformation ratio (NTR) to 50%, but recovery to 70% was observed. Microbial adaptations, including selective enrichment of Thauera and upregulated nirBDS genes, helped mitigate fluoride-induced stress.
population_specificity: Nitrogen-rich wastewater from photovoltaic and semiconductor industries (granule-based PD process).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the cost-effectiveness of silver diamine fluoride (SDF) compared to sodium fluoride (NaF) varnish and direct restorations for caries control and avoidance of tooth extractions in children.
results_summary: SDF was less effective than direct restorations but more cost-effective, especially for children with high-caries activity. The cost-effectiveness of SDF increased with higher caries activity, though direct restorations remained more effective for low-caries activity children.
population_specificity: Children aged 1-6 years in Singapore (N = 231,880).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine how different sintering methods ("rapid" vs. "slow") affect the physicochemical properties and cytotoxicity of fluoride-substituted apatite.
results_summary: Sintering conditions influenced porosity parameters (total pore area, mercury intrusion volume, and average pore diameter) but did not affect composition, chemical structure, or crystalline phase. Both materials were non-toxic, showing no reduction in cell viability.
population_specificity: MC3T3-E1 cells (a pre-osteoblastic cell line)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of a novel adsorbent (AC-Al-Mg-La) in removing fluoride ions from wastewater.
results_summary: The study found that AC-Al-Mg-La achieved peak fluoride adsorption efficiency (96%) under optimal conditions (pH 4.0, 30 min contact time, 0.15 g/L dose), though regeneration cycles reduced effectiveness by 30% over five cycles.
population_specificity: Wastewater (not human or animal subjects).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the enamel remineralization effects of fluoride-incorporated bioactive glass toothpaste (530 ppm fluoride) against higher-fluoride toothpastes (1000 ppm and 1450 ppm) in primary teeth with artificial subsurface caries.
results_summary: The fluoride-incorporated bioactive glass toothpaste (530 ppm fluoride) showed comparable remineralization effects to the 1450 ppm fluoride toothpaste at depths of 0, 40, and 80 μm, with no significant difference between the two. Neither group demonstrated significant remineralization at 120 μm.
population_specificity: Primary maxillary incisors (primary teeth) from children (implied by pediatric focus).
effective_dosage: 530 ppm fluoride (F-BG toothpaste), 1000 ppm fluoride (0.22% NaF), 1450 ppm fluoride (0.32% NaF), applied twice daily as a slurry.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the likelihood of pest freedom in debarked conifer wood chips fumigated with sulfuryl fluoride, focusing on Bursaphelenchus xylophilus and Monochamus spp., as well as other EU quarantine pests.
results_summary: The study found that sulfuryl fluoride fumigation is highly effective in eliminating B. xylophilus and Monochamus spp. from wood chips, with 95% certainty that 9491-10,000 m³ per 10,000 m³ will be pest-free for B. xylophilus and 9987-10,000 m³ for Monochamus spp. However, SF treatments are less effective against fungi.
population_specificity: Debarked conifer wood chips from the United States.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to optimize the fabrication of PVDF-based conductive membranes for enhanced pollutant removal and reduced fouling in electrified wastewater treatment.
results_summary: The study found that PVDF-CMs prepared with optimized conditions (0.9 mol/L pyrrole, 4.8 mmol BVIMBF4, and 0.8 mol/L FeCl3·6H2O) exhibited good conductivity (93 Ω/sq) and hydrophilicity (31° contact angle). Applying an external voltage (2.0 V or 0.5 V) significantly reduced membrane fouling rates for BSA, SA, and HA solutions compared to controls.
population_specificity: Not applicable (in vitro study on membrane performance).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the knowledge and attitudes of Spanish dentists and dental students regarding the use of silver diamine fluoride (SDF) for caries management.
results_summary: Dental students demonstrated significantly higher knowledge of SDF indications and advantages compared to general dentists, though both groups showed reluctance to use SDF in esthetic zones. Implementation rates were low for both groups, indicating a gap between knowledge and practice.
population_specificity: Final-year dental students (n=43) and registered general dentists (n=1050) in Murcia, Spain.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether fluoride impairs lysosomal biosynthesis via GSK3β signaling, leading to neurological damage.
results_summary: The study found that fluoride (NaF) reduced spatial learning and memory abilities, decreased hippocampal neurons, disrupted neuronal arrangement, and increased apoptosis in rats and PC12 cells. It also impaired lysosomal biosynthesis via GSK3β signaling, leading to neurological dysfunction.
population_specificity: In vivo rat models and in vitro PC12 cell models.
study_duration: 24 hours for in vitro PC12 cells (in vivo duration not specified)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the remineralization efficacy of silver diamine fluoride (SDF) combined with potassium iodide (KI) versus sodium fluoride (NaF) varnish on hydroxyapatite (HAP) artificial white spot lesions.
results_summary: SDF-KI treatment showed statistically significant remineralization potential, restoring Vickers hardness values to baseline levels, with higher calcium uptake and more fluoride-substituted apatite formation compared to F-varnish. Both treatments were effective, but SDF-KI demonstrated superior physicochemical and mechanical improvements.
population_specificity: Hydroxyapatite (HAP) disks with artificial white spot lesions (in vitro model).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of 38% silver diamine fluoride (SDF) with different application frequencies in arresting dentine caries in permanent teeth among individuals with intellectual disabilities (ID) and evaluate their treatment cooperation.
results_summary: At 12 months, unadjusted analysis showed significantly higher caries-arresting rates in the group receiving weekly applications initially, but multilevel logistic regression revealed no significant differences between groups. No behavior deterioration was observed, and positive behavioral changes were noted in both groups.
population_specificity: Individuals with intellectual disabilities (ID), aged 6-30 years.
effective_dosage: Group 1: semiannual applications; Group 2: once a week for 3 consecutive weeks, followed by semiannual applications.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess Italian dentists' education, knowledge, and behavior regarding Silver Diamine Fluoride (SDF) use in clinical practice.
results_summary: The study found that Italian dentists had poor education and knowledge of SDF, with low usage rates (20.6%). Dentists familiar with SDF were more likely to use it, especially those caring for patients with special needs or who received good training.
population_specificity: Italian dentists

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the clinical and radiographic success of indirect pulp therapy (IPT) using silver diamine fluoride (SDF), Type VII glass ionomer cement (GIC), and calcium hydroxide (Ca(OH)2) in young permanent molars.
results_summary: The study found comparable clinical and radiographic success rates among SDF (88.2%), Type VII GIC (94.1%), and Ca(OH)2 (88.2%) at 12 months, with no statistically significant differences. SDF showed slightly greater dentin bridge formation compared to the other agents.
population_specificity: 45 children with 60 young permanent first molars.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effect of different fluoride treatments (2% neutral sodium fluoride, 1.23% acidulated phosphate fluoride, and 0.1% fluoride varnish) on the microhardness of resin-modified glass ionomer cement (RM-GIC).
results_summary: The study found that all three fluoride treatments significantly decreased the surface microhardness of RM-GIC, with 1.23% acidulated phosphate fluoride showing the highest variation compared to the other treatments.
population_specificity: Not specified (in vitro study using RM-GIC discs).
effective_dosage: 2% neutral sodium fluoride, 1.23% acidulated phosphate fluoride, and 0.1% fluoride varnish (7700 ppm F).
study_duration: Seven days of immersion in artificial saliva, followed by fluoride exposure.
interactions: Adverse interactions between RM-GIC and fluoride treatments were noted, compromising the material's properties.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the neurotoxic effects of chronic sodium fluoride (NaF) exposure during developmental stages in rats and assess the protective effects of Metformin and Dehydrozingerone (DHZ).
results_summary: NaF exposure significantly impaired learning, memory, locomotor ability, and induced anxiety-like behavior in rat pups, along with elevated oxidative stress markers and neuronal degeneration. Treatment with Metformin and DHZ ameliorated these cognitive impairments and reduced oxidative stress and neuronal damage.
population_specificity: Pregnant rats and their offspring (rat pups).
effective_dosage: NaF (100 ppm orally via drinking water), Metformin & DHZ (200 mg/kg orally).
study_duration: Throughout gestation, lactation, and until the end of the experiment (exact duration not specified).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the survival of teeth treated with repeated applications of 38% silver diamine fluoride (SDF) in children with early childhood caries (ECC) and compare outcomes between single and multiple applications.
results_summary: Repeated applications of 38% SDF showed improved tooth survival rates (94% for double application vs. 58% for single application at 12 months), with statistically significant differences favoring double application. Single applications showed progressive lesion worsening over time.
population_specificity: Children aged 4-5 years with bilateral ECC from a primary government school in Maharashtra, India.
effective_dosage: 38% SDF, applied once (group I) or twice (group II).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of PSFCL as a flocculant for removing fluoride from yellow phosphorus wastewater.
results_summary: PSFCL achieved a 97% removal efficiency for fluoride, with charge neutralization, bridging effect, and ligand exchange identified as the main coagulation mechanisms. The study demonstrated high efficacy in fluoride removal under optimized conditions.
population_specificity: Yellow phosphorus wastewater (industrial application, not human subjects).
effective_dosage: Not specified (optimization included La/Si molar ratio, pH, agitation time, dosage, and sedimentation time, but exact fluoride dosage not detailed).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effectiveness of waste-derived expanded graphite (EG) in removing fluoride from polluted water.
results_summary: The study demonstrated that EG achieved a maximum fluoride removal rate of 97% under optimal conditions (pH 4, 5 g/L adsorbent dose, 30 min contact time). Adsorption followed Langmuir and Freundlich isotherm models, with kinetics aligning with pseudo-first-order.
population_specificity: Wastewater (not human or animal subjects).
effective_dosage: 5 g/L adsorbent dose for 5 mg/L fluoride concentration.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether betanin could mitigate fluoride-induced liver and kidney toxicity in rats.
results_summary: Fluoride exposure increased oxidative stress and liver/kidney damage markers, while betanin treatment reduced these effects and improved histopathological outcomes.
population_specificity: Wistar rats
effective_dosage: 10 mg/kg sodium fluoride, with betanin at 50 mg/kg (low dose) and 200 mg/kg (high dose)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of 38% silver diammine fluoride (SDF) and 5% sodium fluoride varnish (NaFV) on oral health-related quality of life (OHRQoL) in young children with early childhood caries (ECC).
results_summary: The study found significant improvements in overall OHRQoL and family impact scores after treatment with SDF and NaFV, though no significant change in child impact scores was observed. No differences were noted between the three application frequency groups.
population_specificity: Children younger than 72 months with active dentinal caries lesions (ICDAS 5 or 6) in primary teeth.
effective_dosage: Two applications of 38% SDF and 5% NaFV, tested at intervals of one, four, and six months.
study_duration: The intervention duration varied by group (one, four, or six months between applications).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore dental professionals' perceptions of using silver diamine fluoride (SDF) with and without light-curing, and to identify barriers and enabling factors for its use.
results_summary: Most participants preferred light-curing SDF due to perceived benefits like quicker treatment and better moisture control, though some raised concerns about insufficient evidence for its efficacy. A hybrid approach was suggested, avoiding light-curing on anterior teeth while using it on posterior teeth.
population_specificity: Dental professionals (students, practicing dentists, dental hygienists, and academics) aged 22-53 years.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the potential of cerium fluoride (CeF3) nanoparticles modified with flavin mononucleotide (FMN) as a radiosensitizer and antioxidant in X-ray-induced photodynamic therapy (X-PDT) for cancer treatment.
results_summary: The study found that CeF3-FMN nanoparticles exhibited pH-dependent radiation-induced redox activity, generating reactive oxygen species that selectively increased tumor cell radiosensitivity (1.9 times higher) while acting as antioxidants in normal cells. The nanoparticles showed minimal cytotoxicity to normal cells (NCTC L929 fibroblasts) but were more toxic to tumor cells (A431 epidermoid carcinoma).
population_specificity: Tumor cells (A431 epidermoid carcinoma) and normal cells (NCTC L929 fibroblasts).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of fluoride concentration, salt type, product form, and ingredients in daily-use products on enamel remineralization and demineralization protection.
results_summary: Fluoride toothpastes showed a dose-response effect (0-1426ppm F) for enamel remineralization and acid resistance, with one silica-based toothpaste (1150ppm F as NaF) outperforming placebo. Fluoride mouthwash use after toothpaste further improved remineralization, while polyvalent metal ions and polyphosphates negatively affected performance.
population_specificity: Healthy participants wearing intra-oral palatal appliances with enamel specimens.
effective_dosage: 0-1426ppm F in toothpastes; 1150ppm F as NaF in one tested toothpaste.
study_duration: Single use with 4-hour intra-oral remineralization period.
interactions: Negative effects noted with polyvalent metal ions and polyphosphates.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects of Tanshinone IIA on fluoride-induced spinal cord injury and explore the underlying molecular mechanisms, particularly focusing on ferroptosis and inflammation.
results_summary: The study found that excessive fluoride exposure caused spinal cord injury and dysregulated ferroptosis-related genes and inflammatory indicators. Tanshinone IIA restored these alterations, suggesting its therapeutic potential for fluoride-induced neurotoxicity.
population_specificity: Rat model of fluoride-induced spinal cord injury and human osteosarcoma (HOS) cells.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate parents' valuation of fluoride varnish (FV) therapy using the willingness-to-pay (WTP) method.
results_summary: The study found no significant difference in WTP values between fissure sealant and fluoride varnish therapies. Parents visiting private clinics and government employees had higher WTP values, while those without supplemental insurance had lower WTP values. Income level was the main indicator in regression models, especially for WTP values of fissure sealants.
population_specificity: 100 parents in 2021, including those visiting private clinics and government employees.

study_goal: To investigate the antimicrobial effects of copper tetraamine fluoride (CTF) against common microbes associated with dental caries and periodontal disease.
results_summary: CTF demonstrated antimicrobial effects against nine oral pathogens, with MIC ranging from 80 ppm to 640 ppm and MBC/MFC ranging from 320 ppm to 2560 ppm. TEM revealed structural damage to microbial cells, including membrane disruption and cytoplasmic leakage.
population_specificity: Microbial pathogens associated with dental caries and periodontal disease (e.g., Streptococcus mutans, Candida albicans, Porphyromonas gingivalis).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the influence of fluoride on the invasiveness mechanisms of human glioblastoma cells.
results_summary: The study found that sodium fluoride (NaF) at physiologically high concentrations (0.1-10 µM) may promote a pro-invasive phenotype in U-87 glioblastoma cells, increasing migratory and invasive abilities and affecting metalloproteinases MMP-2 and MMP-9 levels.
population_specificity: U-87 human glioblastoma cell line

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess whether green synthesized selenium nanoparticles (Se-NPs) could mitigate fluoride-induced stress and improve growth in Phaseolus vulgaris (common bean) plants.
results_summary: The study found that fluoride (NaF) stress significantly reduced chlorophyll content, protein levels, and antioxidant activity in plants, but application of Se-NPs (70 ppm) via seed priming and foliar spray improved photosynthetic content, nutrient uptake, and overall growth.
population_specificity: Phaseolus vulgaris (common bean) plants grown under fluoride stress conditions.
effective_dosage: 70 ppm Se-NPs applied via seed priming and foliar spray.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess parental acceptance of silver diamine fluoride (SDF) treatment for early childhood caries in Laos and explore factors influencing acceptance, such as staining concerns and dental anxiety.
results_summary: The study found that 80% of parents accepted SDF treatment, with higher acceptance linked to reduced concern about staining and higher parental dental anxiety. Older parents were less concerned about staining and more likely to accept SDF.
population_specificity: Parents of children aged 2-5 years enrolled in preschools in Vientiane Capital, Laos.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the association between trace elements, including Fluoride, and osteoporosis, focusing on molecular mechanisms and clinical effects.
results_summary: The study found that Fluoride, along with other trace elements, may improve bone quality and induce antiosteoporotic effects, with dose-dependent effects—low doses promote osteogenesis, while high doses may impair bone formation.
population_specificity: Not specified (general review of epidemiological and clinical data)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the role of silver diamine fluoride (SDF) in preventing and managing dental caries, evaluating its efficacy and adverse reactions.
results_summary: The study found that SDF showed promising results in caries arrestment, with rates varying from 25% to 99% across participants. It suggests SDF could be a less invasive and cost-effective alternative to traditional treatments, though further research is needed.
population_specificity: Participants aged 1-50 years.
study_duration: Follow-up intervals ranged from 1 to 30 months.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to measure inorganic fluoride and total organofluorine concentrations in the Danube River to assess changes in fluorine levels and the impact of restrictions on PFOA and PFOS compounds.
results_summary: The study found inorganic fluoride concentrations ranging from 28 to 76 µg/L and total organofluorine concentrations between 0.22 and 12.5 µg/L in the Danube River, with a decreasing trend in PFOA and PFOS levels due to restrictions.
population_specificity: Water samples from twelve locations along the Hungarian section of the Danube River.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine the historical and scientific basis for fluoride supplementation recommendations, focusing on potential biases and reversals in expert panel decisions.
results_summary: The study found that fluoride's primary benefit is preventing dental caries, but its narrow therapeutic window raises safety concerns. It also highlighted that private interests influenced scientific reversals regarding fluoride's harms, caries as a micronutrient deficiency marker, and low-carbohydrate diet recommendations.
population_specificity: Not specified (historical analysis of expert panel decisions).

study_goal: To update the 2014 review on dental caries screening and preventive interventions involving fluoride to inform the USPSTF.
results_summary: Topical fluoride use was associated with decreased caries burden and likelihood of incident caries in higher-risk populations, with no increased fluorosis risk. No new trials on dietary fluoride supplementation were identified, but existing evidence supports its benefits in caries reduction.
population_specificity: Children younger than 5 years, particularly higher-risk populations.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of fluoride supplementation and varnish in preventing dental caries in children under 5 years old.
results_summary: The study found moderate net benefits of oral fluoride supplementation for children with fluoride-deficient water and fluoride varnish application for all children under 5 in preventing future dental caries. Routine oral screening for caries in this age group had insufficient evidence to determine benefits or harms.
population_specificity: Asymptomatic children younger than 5 years.
effective_dosage: Recommended doses (specific amounts not detailed in abstract).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review fluoride's preventive effects on caries and assess the balance between its benefits and the risk of dental fluorosis.
results_summary: Fluoride significantly reduces caries incidence but increases dental fluorosis prevalence. Optimal fluoride use requires balancing preventive effects with minimal fluorosis risk, considering various intake sources.
population_specificity: General population in both fluoridated and non-fluoridated communities.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to summarize recent findings on the role of probiotics in dental caries prevention, including the potential mechanisms of probiotic effects, with a mention of insufficient fluoride exposure as a factor in caries development.
results_summary: The abstract highlights that insufficient fluoride exposure is a major factor in caries development but focuses primarily on probiotics' role in reducing caries risk by inhibiting cariogenic bacteria and enriching commensal microbes. Fluoride's specific effects are not detailed in the results.
population_specificity: General population (no specific demographic mentioned).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to summarize scientifically documented community interventions and strategies for caries control in Latin American and Caribbean countries, focusing on fluoride use.
results_summary: The study found that fluoride-based strategies, including drinking water, salt, toothpaste, and other delivery methods, were widely used across multiple countries and effectively contributed to caries control, though monitoring was recommended to minimize fluorosis risk.
population_specificity: Latin American and Caribbean countries, including Argentina, Belize, Bolivia, Brazil, Chile, Colombia, Costa Rica, Cuba, Dominican Republic, Ecuador, El Salvador, Guatemala, Haiti, Honduras, Mexico, Nicaragua, Panama, Paraguay, Peru, Uruguay, and Venezuela.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to highlight the role of fluoride supplementation in improving oral health and reducing dental disease.
results_summary: The abstract suggests fluoride supplementation is beneficial for oral health, particularly in preventing caries and improving dental hygiene, but does not provide specific data on its efficacy.
population_specificity: General population, with mentions of children and adults.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the diagnostic accuracy of various dental imaging methods for detecting non-cavitated enamel caries, indirectly assessing the role of fluoride in early caries management.
results_summary: The study found that imaging methods for early caries detection had poor sensitivity but acceptable specificity, potentially missing early lesions. Topical fluoride was suggested as a low-risk non-invasive management option for detected lesions.
population_specificity: Patients with non-cavitated enamel-only coronal dental caries.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess whether menaquinone (MK-7) supplementation affects vascular calcification in people with type 2 diabetes and known cardiovascular disease, using fluoride-based imaging (18F-NaF PET) as a measurement tool.
results_summary: MK-7 supplementation showed a non-significant trend toward increased active calcification measured by 18F-NaF PET but had no effect on conventional CT calcification. The study also found that MK-7 significantly reduced dp-ucMGP levels, indicating compliance with supplementation.
population_specificity: Adults with type 2 diabetes and known cardiovascular disease.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness and safety of silver diamine fluoride (SDF) as a noninvasive treatment for caries, updating application protocols based on recent clinical trials.
results_summary: The study found SDF to be effective in treating caries, with safety demonstrated in young children, suggesting an intensive initial regimen followed by semiannual maintenance doses. It also highlighted SDF's potential impact on the dental plaque microbiome for caries arrest.
population_specificity: Young children with high caries severity.
effective_dosage: Intensive regimen of multiple applications over the first few weeks, followed by semiannual maintenance doses.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of 10% CPP-ACP and 5% sodium fluoride varnish in regressing nonorthodontic white spot lesions (WSLs) in children.
results_summary: The study found that fluoride varnish alone showed no significant improvement in WSL regression compared to the control, while CPP-ACP paste, either alone or combined with fluoride varnish, significantly improved remineralization and appearance of WSLs. No advantage was observed for fluoride varnish as a supplement to standard or CPP-ACP-enhanced oral hygiene.
population_specificity: 21 children with 101 nonorthodontic white spot lesions.
effective_dosage: 5% sodium fluoride varnish applied weekly for the first month (FV group).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess patient perceptions of oral health, including opinions about fluoride toothpaste, among 19-year-olds in Ostergötland County, Sweden.
results_summary: The study found some uncertainty about the benefits of fluoride toothpaste (7.5% in 2004 and 9.3% in 2011), particularly among boys (10.3% in 2004 and 10.5% in 2011). No direct efficacy or adverse effects of fluoride were reported.
population_specificity: 19-year-olds in Ostergötland County, Sweden (50% men, 50% women).
study_duration: Cross-sectional surveys in 2004 and 2011 (no intervention duration).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if semiannual fluoride varnish applications from 1 year of age reduced caries incidence in toddlers compared to a standard yearly program.
results_summary: The study found no significant difference in caries prevalence or increment between toddlers receiving semiannual fluoride varnish and those on a standard yearly program. At 3 years, 12% of children had moderate/severe caries, with similar increments in both groups.
population_specificity: 1-year-old children from multicultural, low socioeconomic areas in Stockholm (n = 3,403 at baseline).
effective_dosage: Topical fluoride varnish applied every 6 months.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of fluoride supplementation and varnish in preventing dental caries in preschool-aged children and assess the need for routine screening.
results_summary: The study found that prescribing oral fluoride supplementation for children with fluoride-deficient water and applying fluoride varnish to primary teeth are effective in preventing dental caries, but evidence was insufficient to assess the benefits of routine screening by primary care clinicians.
population_specificity: Children aged 5 years and younger.
effective_dosage: Oral fluoride supplementation starting at age 6 months; fluoride varnish applied at primary tooth eruption (specific dosage not mentioned).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of fluoride toothpastes supplemented with sodium trimetaphosphate (TMP) in reducing enamel demineralization.
results_summary: The study found that toothpaste with 1100 ppm fluoride supplemented with 3% TMP was most effective in reducing enamel demineralization and showed higher fluoride concentration in enamel. The results were statistically significant (p < 0.001).
